ch.lambdaj.function.closure
Class Closure4<A,B,C,D>

java.lang.Object
  ch.lambdaj.function.closure.Closure4<A,B,C,D>

public class Closure4<A,B,C,D>
extends Object

A closure with four free variables

Author:
Mario Fusco

          The name used to identify a closure that inokes a constructor

Method Detail

apply

public Object apply(A var1,
                    B var2,
                    C var3,
                    D var4)
Invokes this closure once by applying the given quadruple of variables to it.

Parameters:
var1 - The first variable used to invoke this closure
var2 - The second variable used to invoke this closure
var3 - The third variable used to invoke this closure
var4 - The fourth variable used to invoke this closure
Returns:
The result of the closure invocation

each

public List<?> each(Iterable<? extends A> vars1,
                    Iterable<? extends B> vars2,
                    Iterable<? extends C> vars3,
                    Iterable<? extends D> vars4)
Invokes this closure once for each passed quadruple of variables.

Parameters:
vars1 - The first set of variables used to invoke this closure once for each variable
vars2 - The second set of variables used to invoke this closure once for each variable
vars3 - The third set of variables used to invoke this closure once for each variable
vars4 - The fourth set of variables used to invoke this closure once for each variable
Returns:
A list of Object containing the results of each closure invocation

curry1

public Closure3<B,C,D> curry1(A curry)
Curry this closure by fixing its first free variable to a given value.

Parameters:
curry - The value to which the first variable should be curry
Returns:
A Closure having two free variables

curry2

public Closure3<A,C,D> curry2(B curry)
Curry this closure by fixing its second free variable to a given value.

Parameters:
curry - The value to which the second variable should be curry
Returns:
A Closure having two free variables

public Closure3<A,B,D> curry3(C curry)
Curry this closure by fixing its third free variable to a given value.

Parameters:
curry - The value to which the third variable should be curry
Returns:
A Closure having two free variables

curry4

public Closure3<A,B,C> curry4(D curry)
Curry this closure by fixing its fourth free variable to a given value.

Parameters:
curry - The value to which the third variable should be curry
Returns:
A Closure having two free variables

of

public Closure4<A,B,C,D> of(Object closedObject,
                            String methodName,
                            Object... args)
Defines the method invoked by this closure.

Parameters:
closedObject - The object on which the closure has to be invoked. It can be a fixed object or a Class. In this last case, if the method is not static, it is treated as it was an unbound argument defined through the Lambda.var(Class) method
methodName - The name of the method invoked by this closure or AbstractClosure.CONSTRUCTOR if you want to call a constructor
args - The arguments used to invoke this closure. They can be a mixed of fixed value and unbound one defined through the Lambda.var(Class) method
Returns:
The closure itself

of

public <T> T of(Class<T> closedClass)
Binds a free variable of the given class to the this closure.

Parameters:
closedClass - The type of the free variable to be bound to this closure
Returns:
A proxy of the same class of the passed class used to register all the invocation on the closed object

of

public <T> T of(T closed)
Binds an object to this closure.

Parameters:
closed - The object that has to be bound to this closure
Returns:
A proxy of the same class of the passed object used to register all the invocation on the closed object

of

public <T> T of(Object closed,
                Class<T> closedClass)
Binds an object to this closure.

Parameters:
closed - The object that has to be bound to this closure
closedClass - The actual class of the proxied object
Returns:
An instance of the closedClass that is actually a proxy used to register all the invocation on the closed object

getFreeVarsNumber

public int getFreeVarsNumber()
Returns the number of free variables in this closure

Returns:
The number of free variables in this closure

cast

public <T> T cast(Class<T> asInterface)
       throws IllegalArgumentException
Dynamically casts this closure to a one-method interface in order to invoke its method in a strongly typed way

Parameters:
asInterface - The interface to which this closure should be casted
Returns:
A proxy that implements the requested interface and wraps this closure
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the given Class is not actually an interface or if it has more than one method
